Title: DAGs: Your Visual Roadmap to Understanding Cause and Effect
Causal Reinforcement Learning: Do-Calculus for Better Policies
Interpretable Machine Learning for Time Series Predictions
Introduction to Fundamentals of Statistics for Data Analysis
A Gentle Introduction to Causal Inference
Summary (3-line): Beginner-friendly overview of causal inference; distinguishes correlation vs causation; introduces DAGs and interventions.
Key Takeaways: Defines interventions and counterfactual framing; introduces SCMs/DAGs; motivation for identification vs prediction.

Title: Difference-in-Differences (DiD) Explained with Python
Summary (3-line): Hands-on DiD estimator with Python; uses pre/post treated vs control groups and parallel trends assumption.
Key Takeaways: Constructs DiD design; estimates with statsmodels; checks sensitivity to violations (parallel trends, anticipation).

Title: Double Machine Learning for Causal Inference
Summary (3-line): Introduces DoubleML framework: orthogonalization + sample-splitting to estimate causal parameters with ML nuisance models.
Key Takeaways: Separates nuisance components (m(x), e(x)); Neyman orthogonality for robustness; √n asymptotics with cross-fitting.

Title: Understanding Heterogeneous Treatment Effect (Part 2)
Summary (3-line): Explores heterogeneous treatment effects (HTE) and meta-learners for CATE estimation (T-, S-, X-learners).
Key Takeaways: Defines CATE; compares meta-learner strategies; cautions on overlap/positivity and model selection.

Title: Mind the Gap: Overcoming Low Overlap in Propensity Score Distributions for Causal Inference
Summary (3-line): Discusses practical fixes for low-overlap/positivity issues in propensity score estimation and effect identification.
Key Takeaways: Diagnosing poor overlap; trimming, overlap weights, calipers; trade-offs between bias and variance in practice.

Title: Causal Representation Learning with Generative Models
Summary (3-line): Paper on causal representation learning integrated with generative models; connects latent causal factors to downstream tasks.
Key Takeaways: Formulates causal generative process; leverages generative models to identify/learn disentangled causal factors.
Tags: causal representation learning; generative models; supplement

Title: Causal Inference and the Do Operator (Beginner’s Guide)
Summary (3-line): Intro to the do-operator and interventions with simple DAGs; frames why causal differs from correlational analysis.
Key Takeaways: Defines do(X); shows confounding paths; motivates identification via graph-based criteria.

Title: Estimating Causal Effects with Do-Calculus in Python
Summary (3-line): Practical identification/estimation in Python using DoWhy; demonstrates back-door/front-door adjustments.
Key Takeaways: Encodes SCMs; uses identify_effect/estimate_effect; links graph structure to estimators and refuters.

Title: When “do(X)” Matters: Advertising Spend and Sales Lift
Summary (3-line): Applied case that separates ad spend effects from seasonality via adjustment sets and interventions.
Key Takeaways: Builds DAG; finds valid adjustment set; contrasts naive OLS with identified causal effect.

Title: Introduction to Judea Pearl’s Do-Calculus
Summary (3-line): Math-forward primer on Rules 1–3 of do-calculus and identifiability; connects graph separation with algebraic manipulation.
Key Takeaways: States and applies Rules 1–3; demonstrates deriving P(Y|do(X)) from DAG assumptions; links to identification algorithms.
